body: # caridina ü¶ê A [Matrix](https://matrix.org) client library written in [Crystal](https://crystal-lang.org). It is also a species of shrimp, one of them being named "crystal red". Crystal for the language, red for the Matrix's red pill. ## Installation 1. Add the dependency to your `shard.yml`: ```yaml dependencies: caridina: github: erdnaxeli/caridina ``` 2. Run `shards install` ## Usage The API documentation is available [here](https://erdnaxeli.github.io/caridina/Caridina/Connection.html). ### Connecting Create a new connection object: ```crystal require "caridina" conn = Caridina::Connection.new( "https://my-favorite-hs.example.org", "my access token", ) ``` You can also login to get a new access token: ```crystal access_token = Caridina::Connection.login( "https://my-favorite-hs.example.org", "@mybotuserid:my-favorite-hs.example.org", "my secret password", ) ``` ### Sync Now we can create a new channel, and tell the connection object to start syncing. The sync responses will be streamed in the channel. ```Crystal matrix = Channel(Caridina::Responses::Sync).new conn.sync(matrix) sync = matrix.receive ``` You have now a [sync response](src/response/sync.cr). If you don't want to go through the whole sync response by yourself (which is understandable), we provide you a [Caridina::Syncer](src/syncer.cr) object. ```Crystal require "caridina/syncer" syncer = Caridina::Syncer.new syncer.on(Caridina::Events::Message) do |event| event = event.as(Caridina::Events::Message) # TODO: actually do something end syncer.process_response(sync) ``` > :warning: The syncer is a new feature still in development. > It currently only supports events in the joined rooms timeline. > To access to other events, you need to go through the sync response. ### Read event The events in the sync response are all `Caridina::Events::Event` objects. You need to restrict the type of an event object to access all its fields. ```Crystal sync.rooms.try &.join.each do |room_id, room| room.timeline.events.each do |event| case event when Caridina::Events::Member # someone's membership changed when Caridina::Events::PowerLevels # some authorization changed when Caridina::Events::Message # someone talked else # unknown event end end end ``` Sometimes the event's content can be polymorphic too. That is especially the case for message events. By using again a `case` clause to `event.content` you can restrict its type to access all its fields. ### Send events There is not a single method to send an event. Instead this library provides a set of methods that correspond to different actions you may want to do. You usually do not need to worry about crafting the event to send. > :warning: This part is in a early stage. > Only a few methods are currently provided. ```Crystal # join a room conn.join("!room_id:matrix.org") # send a message event_id = conn.send_message("!room_id:matrix.org", "Hello, world!") # edit a message conn.edit_message("!room_id:matrix.org", event_id, "Hello, world!") # send a read receipt conn.send_receipt("!room_id:matrix.org", "$event_id:matrix.org") # Use the typing notification as a loader conn.typing("!room_id:matrix.org") do # Do some processing. # While we are in the block, a typing notification will be shown on the given # room. conn.send_message("!room_id:matrix.org", "All done!") end ``` ## Development Install the dependencies with `shards install`. * `make test` runs the tests * `make lint` runs the formater plus a linter ## Contributing 1. Fork it () 2. Create your feature branch (`git checkout -b my-new-feature`) 3. Commit your changes (`git commit -am 'Add some feature'`) 4. Push to the branch (`git push origin my-new-feature`) 5. Create a new Pull Request ## Contributors - [erdnaxeli](https://github.com/erdnaxeli) - creator and maintainer

macros.name: caridina_use_json_discriminator

def.name: caridina_use_json_discriminator

types.name: Connection
types.doc:
A Matrix connection.

This is the main entrypoint for this library.
You will find here all methods to interact with the Matrix API.

Those methods handle retrying when the connection is
being rate limited.
If there is another error, an `ExecError` while be returned.

class_methods.name: login
class_methods.doc:
Logs in using to a given homeserver and returns the access token.

[Matrix API](https://matrix.org/docs/spec/client_server/r0.6.1#post-matrix-client-r0-login)
class_methods.summary: Logs in using to a given homeserver and returns the access token.
class_methods.args_string: (hs_url : String, user_id : String, password : String) : String
class_methods.args_html: (hs_url : String, user_id : String, password : String) : String

def.name: login
def.body:
data = {type: "m.login.password", identifier: {type: "m.id.user", user: user_id}, password: password}
response = HTTP::Client.post("#{hs_url}/_matrix/client/r0/login", headers: HTTP::Headers {"Content-Type" => "application/json"}, body: data.to_json)
if !response.success?
  raise(Exception.new("Error with status_code #{response.status_code}"))
end
data = Hash(String, String).from_json(response.body)
data["access_token"]

Creates a sync filter and returns its id.

The *filter* parameter must be a JSON serializable object.

instance_methods.summary: Creates a sync filter and returns its id.

def.name: create_filter
def.body:
response = post("/user/#{@user_id}/filter", filter)
response = Responses::Filter.from_json(response)
response.filter_id

instance_methods.doc:
Edits a message.

Only `m.text` messages are supported for now.
instance_methods.summary: Edits a message.

def.name: edit_message
def.body:
tx_id = get_tx_id
data = Events::Message::MSC2676::Text.new(message, html, event_id)
put("/rooms/#{room_id}/send/m.room.message/#{tx_id}", data)

def.name: send_message
def.body:
tx_id = get_tx_id
payload = Events::Message::Text.new(message, html)
data = put("/rooms/#{room_id}/send/m.room.message/#{tx_id}", payload)
(Responses::Send.from_json(data)).event_id

instance_methods.name: sync
instance_methods.doc:
Starts syncing.

This method starts a new fiber wich will run sync queries, and send received
events in *channel*.

It uses a filter to limit the received events to supported ones.

When called, it will first do an inital sync.
This first sync may return events you already seen in a previous sync.
You should handle this in your code, either by skipping the first sync or
by storing the id of the events you processed.

TODO: accept an *next_batch* parameter to skip the initial sync.

[Matrix API](https://matrix.org/docs/spec/client_server/r0.6.1#get-matrix-client-r0-sync)
instance_methods.summary: Starts syncing.

def.name: sync
def.body:
if @syncing
  raise(Exception.new("Already syncing"))
end
filter = {account_data: {types: [] of String}, presence: {types: [] of String}, room: {account_data: {types: [] of String}, ephemeral: {types: [] of String}, timeline: {lazy_load_members: true}, state: {lazy_load_members: true}}}
filter_id = create_filter(filter)
spawn do
  next_batch = nil
  loop do
    begin
      if next_batch.nil?
        response = get("/sync", is_sync: true, filter: filter_id)
      else
        response = get("/sync", is_sync: true, filter: filter_id, since: next_batch, timeout: 300000)
      end
    rescue ex : ExecError
      Log.error(exception: ex) do
        "Error while syncing, waiting 10s before retry"
      end
      sleep(10)
      next
    end
    sync = Responses::Sync.from_json(response)
    next_batch = sync.next_batch
    channel.send(sync)
  end
end

You probably should use `user_id` which already store that information.

make_redacted
make_relates_to
def.body:
# Represents a relation to another event.

    
#

    
# [Matrix API](https://matrix.org/docs/spec/client_server/r0.6.1#forming-relationships-between-events)

    struct RelatesTo
      include JSON::Serializable

      getter rel_type : String?
      getter 
event_id : String?

      def initialize(@rel_type, @event_id)
      
end
    
end

    
# This implements MSC2674 (event relationships).

    
#

    
# [Matrix MSC](https://github.com/matrix-org/matrix-doc/pull/2674)

    @[JSON::Field(key: "m.relates_to")]
    getter relates_to : RelatesTo?

{{ name }}

{{ yield }}

    
end

{{ name }}

      getter content : 
{{ name.id }}
::Content

      getter state_key : String
      getter type : String

      property room_id : String?
    
end

types.name: Event
types.doc:
Base type representing an event.

All types returned by the `Caridina::Connection::Sync` method will be
of this type.
You can then match the returned event type against known types to be able
to use all the event's field.

If the event is unknown, it returns nil.

def.name: new
def.body:
location = pull.location
discriminators = Array(Tuple(String | Array(String), String)).new
json = String.build do |io|
  JSON.build(io) do |builder|
    builder.start_object
    pull.read_object do |key|
      case key
      when "type"
        value = pull.read_string
        builder.field(key, value)
        discriminators << {key, value}
      else
        builder.field(key) do
          pull.read_raw(builder)
        end
      end
    end
    builder.end_object
  end
end
fields = ["type"]
if discriminators.size
else
  raise(::JSON::SerializableError.new("JSON is missing one of discriminator fields: #{fields}", to_s, nil, *location, nil))
end
discriminators.sort_by! do |x|
  (fields.index(x[0])) || 0
end.reverse!
discriminators.each do |field_name, discriminator_value|
  case field_name
  when "type"
    key = "\"type\""
    case discriminator_value
    when "m.room.canonical_alias"
      begin
        return CanonicalAlias.from_json(json)
      rescue JSON::SerializableError
        begin
          return RedactedCanonicalAlias.from_json(json)
        rescue JSON::SerializableError
          raise(JSON::SerializableError.new("No type can deserialize the given JSON. The key used was #{key}", to_s, nil, *location, nil))
        end
      end
    when "m.room.create"
      begin
        return Create.from_json(json)
      rescue JSON::SerializableError
        begin
          return RedactedCreate.from_json(json)
        rescue JSON::SerializableError
          raise(JSON::SerializableError.new("No type can deserialize the given JSON. The key used was #{key}", to_s, nil, *location, nil))
        end
      end
    when "m.room.join_rules"
      begin
        return JoinRules.from_json(json)
      rescue JSON::SerializableError
        begin
          return RedactedJoinRules.from_json(json)
        rescue JSON::SerializableError
          raise(JSON::SerializableError.new("No type can deserialize the given JSON. The key used was #{key}", to_s, nil, *location, nil))
        end
      end
    when "m.room.member"
      begin
        return Member.from_json(json)
      rescue JSON::SerializableError
        begin
          return RedactedMember.from_json(json)
        rescue JSON::SerializableError
          raise(JSON::SerializableError.new("No type can deserialize the given JSON. The key used was #{key}", to_s, nil, *location, nil))
        end
      end
    when "m.room.power_levels"
      begin
        return PowerLevels.from_json(json)
      rescue JSON::SerializableError
        begin
          return RedactedPowerLevels.from_json(json)
        rescue JSON::SerializableError
          raise(JSON::SerializableError.new("No type can deserialize the given JSON. The key used was #{key}", to_s, nil, *location, nil))
        end
      end
    when "m.room.redaction"
      begin
        return Redaction.from_json(json)
      rescue JSON::SerializableError
        begin
          return RedactedRedaction.from_json(json)
        rescue JSON::SerializableError
          raise(JSON::SerializableError.new("No type can deserialize the given JSON. The key used was #{key}", to_s, nil, *location, nil))
        end
      end
    when "m.room.message"
      begin
        return Message.from_json(json)
      rescue JSON::SerializableError
        begin
          return RedactedMessage.from_json(json)
        rescue JSON::SerializableError
          raise(JSON::SerializableError.new("No type can deserialize the given JSON. The key used was #{key}", to_s, nil, *location, nil))
        end
      end
    end
  else
    raise(Exception.new("This can't happen"))
  end
end
Unknown.from_json(json)

types.name: Content
types.doc:
Represents a m.room.message event's content.

This event's content can have different fields according to its field
`msgtype`.
Each available content is represent by its own type.
To know which message event you are dealing with, you can use a case clause
over the content's type.

```
case event.content
when Caridina::Events::Message::Text
  # handle a message
when Caridina::Events::Message::MSC2676::Text
  # handle a message edit
when Caridina::Events::Message::Unknown
  # Unknown message type, but you can still inspect `event.content.body` and
  # `event.content.msgtype`.
else
  # fallback
end
```

[Matrix API](https://matrix.org/docs/spec/client_server/r0.6.1#m-room-message)

def.name: new
def.body:
location = pull.location
discriminators = Array(Tuple(String | Array(String), String)).new
json = String.build do |io|
  JSON.build(io) do |builder|
    builder.start_object
    pull.read_object do |key|
      case key
      when "msgtype"
        value = pull.read_string
        builder.field(key, value)
        discriminators << {key, value}
      when "m.relates_to"
        field_name = ["m.relates_to"]
        builder.field(key) do
          builder.start_object
          pull.read_object do |key|
            case key
            when "rel_type"
              field_name << "rel_type"
              value = pull.read_string
              builder.field(key, value)
              discriminators << {field_name, value}
            else
              builder.field(key) do
                pull.read_raw(builder)
              end
            end
          end
          builder.end_object
        end
      else
        builder.field(key) do
          pull.read_raw(builder)
        end
      end
    end
    builder.end_object
  end
end
fields = ["msgtype", ["m.relates_to", "rel_type"]]
if discriminators.size
else
  raise(::JSON::SerializableError.new("JSON is missing one of discriminator fields: #{fields}", to_s, nil, *location, nil))
end
discriminators.sort_by! do |x|
  (fields.index(x[0])) || 0
end.reverse!
discriminators.each do |field_name, discriminator_value|
  case field_name
  when "msgtype"
    key = "\"msgtype\""
    case discriminator_value
    when "m.text"
      return Text.from_json(json)
    end
  when ["m.relates_to", "rel_type"]
    key = "[\"m.relates_to\", \"rel_type\"]"
    case discriminator_value
    when "m.replace"
      return MSC2676::Dispatcher.from_json(json)
    end
  else
    raise(Exception.new("This can't happen"))
  end
end
Unknown.from_json(json)

Returns the content that will replace the previous message's content.

Like a message's content, this new content can vary and you should use
a case clause to know what it is.

types.name: RelatesTo
types.doc:
Represents a relation to another event.

[Matrix API](https://matrix.org/docs/spec/client_server/r0.6.1#forming-relationships-between-events)

types.name: StrippedState
types.doc:
Represents a StrippedState event.

It is used in `Member` event and in `Responses::Sync` in invited rooms' state.
It contains a subset of state events' fields.

This type is used to represents many distinct stripped state events. See
subtypes.

constructors.name: new
constructors.doc:
Represents a StrippedState event.

It is used in `Member` event and in `Responses::Sync` in invited rooms' state.
It contains a subset of state events' fields.

This type is used to represents many distinct stripped state events. See
subtypes.

def.name: new
def.body:
location = pull.location
discriminators = Array(Tuple(String | Array(String), String)).new
json = String.build do |io|
  JSON.build(io) do |builder|
    builder.start_object
    pull.read_object do |key|
      case key
      when "type"
        value = pull.read_string
        builder.field(key, value)
        discriminators << {key, value}
      else
        builder.field(key) do
          pull.read_raw(builder)
        end
      end
    end
    builder.end_object
  end
end
fields = ["type"]
if discriminators.size
else
  raise(::JSON::SerializableError.new("JSON is missing one of discriminator fields: #{fields}", to_s, nil, *location, nil))
end
discriminators.sort_by! do |x|
  (fields.index(x[0])) || 0
end.reverse!
discriminators.each do |field_name, discriminator_value|
  case field_name
  when "type"
    key = "\"type\""
    case discriminator_value
    when "m.room.canonical_alias"
      return StrippedCanonicalAlias.from_json(json)
    when "m.room.create"
      return StrippedCreate.from_json(json)
    when "m.room.join_rules"
      return StrippedJoinRules.from_json(json)
    when "m.room.member"
      return StrippedMember.from_json(json)
    when "m.room.power_levels"
      return StrippedPowerLevels.from_json(json)
    end
  else
    raise(Exception.new("This can't happen"))
  end
end
StrippedUnknown.from_json(json)

Sends a receipt.

The only available type so far is a read receipt.

[Matrix API](https://matrix.org/docs/spec/client_server/r0.6.1#post-matrix-client-r0-rooms-roomid-receipt-receipttype-eventid)
instance_methods.summary: Sends a receipt.
instance_methods.args_string: (room_id : String, event_id : String, type = Type::Read) : Nil
instance_methods.args_html: (room_id : String, event_id : String, type = Type::Read) : Nil

instance_methods.name: to_s
instance_methods.doc:
Returns a `String` representation of this enum member.
In the case of regular enums, this is just the name of the member.
In the case of flag enums, it's the names joined by vertical bars, or "None",
if the value is zero.

If an enum's value doesn't match a member's value, the raw value
is returned as a string.

```
Color::Red.to_s                     # => "Red"
IOMode::None.to_s                   # => "None"
(IOMode::Read | IOMode::Write).to_s # => "Read | Write"

Color.new(10).to_s # => "10"
```
instance_methods.summary: Returns a String representation of this enum member.

instance_methods.name: send_typing
instance_methods.doc:
Sends a typing notification

[Matrix API](https://matrix.org/docs/spec/client_server/r0.6.1#put-matrix-client-r0-rooms-roomid-typing-userid)
instance_methods.summary: Sends a typing notification
instance_methods.args_string: (room_id : String, timeout = 3000, typing = true) : Nil
instance_methods.args_html: (room_id : String, timeout = 3000, typing = true) : Nil

instance_methods.name: typing
instance_methods.doc:
Keeps sending a typing notification while the block runs.

The notification is sent every 30 seconds.
Once the block ends, it sends a last call to stop the notification typing.
instance_methods.summary: Keeps sending a typing notification while the block runs.

def.name: typing
def.body:
channel = Channel(Nil).new
spawn do
  timeout = 30000
  send_typing(room_id, timeout: timeout)
  loop do
    select
when channel.receive?
      send_typing(room_id, typing: false)
      break
when timeout(timeout.milliseconds)
      send_typing(room_id, timeout: timeout)
end

  end
end
yield
channel.close

types.name: Syncer
types.doc:
This object allow you to register listeners to be executed when some events
are received.

This avoid you to have to parse the whole `Responses::Sync`.
However `#process_response` must be called with a `Responses::Sync` manually.
This allow you to control precisely when you want to handle events.

```
syncer = Caridina::Syncer.new
syncer.on(Caridina::Events::Message) do |event|
  # TODO: actually do something
end

syncer.process_response(sync)
```

Events sent to listeners are `Events::Event` objects.
You should use a type restriction in order to access all their fields.
types.summary: This object allow you to register listeners to be executed when some events are received.

instance_methods.name: on
instance_methods.args_string: (event_type : Events::Event.class, source = Source::All, &listener : EventListener) : Nil
instance_methods.args_html: (event_type : Events::Event.class, source = Source::All, &listener : EventListener) : Nil

instance_methods.name: on
instance_methods.args_string: (event_type : Events::Event.class, source = Source::All, listener : EventListener? = nil) : Nil
instance_methods.args_html: (event_type : Events::Event.class, source = Source::All, listener : EventListener? = nil) : Nil

def.name: on
process_response
def.body:
if rooms = sync.rooms
  rooms.join.each do |room_id, room|
    room.timeline.events.each do |event|
      if event = event.as?(Events::RoomEvent)
        event.room_id = room_id
        dispatch(event, Source::JoinedRooms)
      end
    end
  end
  rooms.invite.each do |room_id, room|
    room.invite_state.events.each do |event|
      event.room_id = room_id
      dispatch(event, Source::InvitedRooms)
    end
  end
end
